p: Furthermore, physicians can advocate for policy change, as individual practitioners or collectively through professional associations, such as the American College of Physicians, American Medical Association, and the Global Climate and Health Alliance. These organizations can use their power and influence on public policy to add credence to the climate change discussion and move it from debate to planning and prevention. While some consider climate change a politicized issue, it is easier for a policymaker to pay attention to climate change when it is framed as a health issue. Indeed, physician advocacy is having an impact on policymakers, as evidenced by the first Summit on Public Health and Climate Change at the White House in summer 2015 ( Frieden, 2015).
